intro: Onosma bozakmanii, commonly known as the Bozakman poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Turkey. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes other well-known genera such as Papaver and Eschscholzia. The plant is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, high-altitude conditions. Onosma bozakmanii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
